root.name: Commander Keen 1: Marooned on Mars
root.description: OverviewCommander Keen 1: Marooned on Mars is a side-scrolling action game developed by id Software. It is first game in the Commander Keen franchise and the first part of the Invasion of the Vorticons episode (which spans the first three Commander Keen games). It was published by Apogee Software and released on December 14, 1990 as shareware.StoryAliens from the planet Vorticon VI has found out about Billy Blaze—aka Commander Keen—and are planning his destruction. While the unsuspecting child genius is out exploring the mountains of Mars, the evil Vorticons steal vital parts of his ship, taking them to distant Martian cities. Can Commander Keen find all the missing parts, and stop the Vorticon invasion?Missing PartsThe star ship was constructed from various objects Billy found around the house, which he modified into star ship parts. The Vorticons have hidden the objects at the far reaches of March, and Billy—with your help—must find them. The objects that need to be retrieved are:JoystickFunction: Manual flight controlOrigin: From Billy’s brother’s video gameCar BatteryFunction: Electrical systems powerOrigin: From Billy’s mother’s carVacuum CleanerFunction: Ion propulsion unit, with carpet height adjustmentOrigin: From the kitchen, heavily modifiedEverclearFunction: FuelOrigin: From Billy’s dad’s liquor cabinetPC System RequirementsMinimum: A 100% Windows 2000/XP/Vista-compatible computer system
